{{cpp/experimental/ranges/title|InputIterator}}
{{cpp/experimental/ranges/iterator/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=experimental/ranges/iterator|since=ranges|1=
template&lt; class I &gt;
concept bool InputIterator =
    Iterator&lt;I&gt; &amp;&amp; Readable&lt;I&gt; &amp;&amp;
    requires { typename ranges::iterator_category_t&lt;I&gt;; } &amp;&amp;
    DerivedFrom&lt;ranges::iterator_category_t&lt;I&gt;, ranges::input_iterator_tag&gt;;
}}

The {{tt|InputIterator}} concept is a refinement of {{rconcept|Iterator}}, adding the requirement that the referenced values can be read (via {{rconcept|Readable}}) and the requirement that the iterator category tag be present.

===Notes===
Unlike the input iterator requirements in the C++ standard, {{tt|InputIterator}} in the Ranges TS does not require {{rconcept|EqualityComparable}}.
